requests.doc: When using TCP transport, must be the first message sent

When called, defines the entire duration of the daemon's life.

Cancelling that conversation (or closing the TCP connection) will
shut down the daemon after all other requests have finished. This
allows gracefully switching to another daemon.

This conversation is also used to send all global notifications,
regarding data that's fetched, network state, etc.

Note that this call never returns - you have to cancel it when you're
done with the daemon.
When called, gracefully shutdown the butler daemon.

Retrieves the version of the butler instance the client
is connected to.

This endpoint is meant to gather information when reporting
issues, rather than feature sniffing. Conforming clients should
automatically download new versions of butler, see the **Updating** section.

fields.name: version
fields.doc: Something short, like `v8.0.0`

fields.name: versionString
fields.doc: Something long, like `v8.0.0, built on Aug 27 2017 @ 01:13:55, ref d833cc0aeea81c236c81dffb27bc18b2b8d8b290`

fields.name: enabled
fields.doc:
If true, all operations after this point will behave
as if there were no network connections

fields.name: enabled
fields.doc: If true, will limit. If false, will clear any bandwidth throttles in place

fields.name: rate
fields.doc: The target bandwidth, in kbps

requests.doc: Lists remembered profiles

fields.name: profiles
fields.doc: A list of remembered profiles

requests.doc: Add a new profile by password login

fields.name: username
fields.doc: The username (or e-mail) to use for login

fields.name: password
fields.doc: The password to use

fields.name: forceRecaptcha
fields.doc: Set to true if you want to force recaptcha

fields.name: profile
fields.doc: Information for the new profile, now remembered

fields.name: cookie
fields.doc: Profile cookie for website

requests.doc:
Add a new profile by API key login. This can be used
for integration tests, for example. Note that no cookies
are returned for this kind of login.

fields.name: apiKey
fields.doc: The API token to use

fields.name: profile
fields.doc: Information for the new profile, now remembered

requests.doc:
Add a new profile by exchanging an OAuth authorization code.
Used by the itch.io desktop app for OAuth login flow with PKCE.

fields.name: code
fields.doc: The authorization code from OAuth redirect

fields.name: codeVerifier
fields.doc: The PKCE code verifier (the original random string used to generate code_challenge)

fields.name: redirectUri
fields.doc: The redirect URI that was used in the authorization request

fields.name: clientId
fields.doc: The OAuth client ID used in the authorization request

fields.name: profile
fields.doc: Information for the new profile, now remembered

fields.name: cookie
fields.doc: Profile cookie for website

requests.doc:
Ask the user to solve a captcha challenge
Sent during @@ProfileLoginWithPasswordParams if certain
conditions are met.

fields.name: recaptchaUrl
fields.doc: Address of page containing a recaptcha widget

fields.name: recaptchaResponse
fields.doc: The response given by recaptcha after it's been filled

requests.doc:
Ask the user to provide a TOTP token.
Sent during @@ProfileLoginWithPasswordParams if the user has
two-factor authentication enabled.

fields.name: code
fields.doc: The TOTP code entered by the user

requests.doc: Use saved login credentials to validate a profile.

fields.name: profile
fields.doc: Information for the now validated profile

requests.doc:
Forgets a remembered profile - it won't appear in the
@@ProfileListParams results anymore.

fields.name: success
fields.doc: True if the profile did exist (and was successfully forgotten)

requests.doc: Stores some data associated to a profile, by key.
Retrieves some data associated to a profile, by key.

fields.name: ok
fields.doc: True if the value existed

requests.doc: Searches for games.
Searches for users.
Fetches information for an itch.io game.

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Identifier of game to look for

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: Force an API request

fields.name: game
fields.doc: Game info

fields.name: stale
fields.doc: Marks that a request should be issued afterwards with 'Fresh' set

requests.doc:
Fetches game records - owned, installed, in collection,
with search, etc. Includes download key info, cave info, etc.

fields.name: profileId
fields.doc: Profile to use to fetch game

fields.name: source
fields.doc: Source from which to fetch games

fields.name: collectionId
fields.doc: Collection ID, required if `Source` is "collection"

fields.name: limit
fields.doc: Maximum number of games to return at a time

fields.name: offset
fields.doc: Games to skip

fields.name: search
fields.doc: When specified only shows game titles that contain this string

fields.name: sortBy
fields.doc: Criterion to sort by

fields.name: filters
fields.doc: Filters

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: If set, will force fresh data

fields.name: records
fields.doc: All the records that were fetched

fields.name: stale
fields.doc: Marks that a request should be issued afterwards with 'Fresh' set

requests.doc: Fetches a download key

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: Force an API request

fields.name: stale
fields.doc: Marks that a request should be issued afterwards with 'Fresh' set

requests.doc: Fetches multiple download keys

fields.name: offset
fields.doc: Number of items to skip

fields.name: limit
fields.doc: Max number of results per page (default = 5)

fields.name: filters
fields.doc: Filter results

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: Force an API request

fields.name: items
fields.doc: All the download keys found in the local DB.

fields.name: stale
fields.doc:
Whether the information was fetched from a stale cache,
and could warrant a refresh if online.

requests.doc: Fetches uploads for an itch.io game

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Identifier of the game whose uploads we should look for

fields.name: compatible
fields.doc: Only returns compatible uploads

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: Force an API request

fields.name: uploads
fields.doc: List of uploads

fields.name: stale
fields.doc:
Marks that a request should be issued
afterwards with 'Fresh' set

requests.doc: Fetches information for an itch.io user.

fields.name: userId
fields.doc: Identifier of the user to look for

fields.name: profileId
fields.doc: Profile to use to look upser

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: Force an API request

fields.name: user
fields.doc: User info

fields.name: stale
fields.doc:
Marks that a request should be issued
afterwards with 'Fresh' set

requests.doc:
Fetches the best current *locally cached* sale for a given
game.

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Identifier of the game for which to look for a sale

requests.doc:
Fetch a collection's title, gamesCount, etc.
but not its games.

fields.name: profileId
fields.doc: Profile to use to fetch collection

fields.name: collectionId
fields.doc: Collection to fetch

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc:
Force an API request before replying.
Usually set after getting 'stale' in the response.

fields.name: collection
fields.doc: Collection info

fields.name: stale
fields.doc:
True if the info was from local DB and
it should be re-queried using "Fresh"

requests.doc:
Fetches information about a collection and the games it
contains.

fields.name: profileId
fields.doc: Profile to use to fetch collection

fields.name: collectionId
fields.doc: Identifier of the collection to look for

fields.name: limit
fields.doc: Maximum number of games to return at a time.

fields.name: search
fields.doc: When specified only shows game titles that contain this string

fields.name: sortBy
fields.doc: Criterion to sort by

fields.name: filters
fields.doc: Filters

fields.name: cursor
fields.doc: Used for pagination, if specified

fields.name: fresh
fields.doc: If set, will force fresh data

fields.name: items
fields.doc: Requested games for this collection

fields.name: nextCursor
fields.doc: Use to fetch the next 'page' of results

fields.name: stale
fields.doc: If true, re-issue request with 'Fresh'

requests.doc:
Lists collections for a profile. Does not contain
games.

fields.name: items

fields.name: nextCursor

fields.name: limit

fields.doc: Used for pagination, if specified

fields.name: items
fields.doc: Profile games

fields.name: nextCursor
fields.doc: Used to fetch the next page

fields.name: stale
fields.doc: If true, re-issue request with "Fresh"

fields.name: limit

fields.name: items
fields.doc: Download keys fetched for profile

fields.name: nextCursor

requests.doc: Retrieve info for all caves.

fields.doc: Maximum number of caves to return at a time.

fields.name: search
fields.doc: When specified only shows game titles that contain this string

fields.name: filters
fields.doc: Filters

fields.name: cursor
fields.doc: Used for pagination, if specified

fields.name: nextCursor
fields.doc: Use to fetch the next 'page' of results

requests.doc: Retrieve info on a cave by ID.
Mark all local data as stale.
Finds uploads compatible with the current runtime, for a given game.

fields.name: game
fields.doc: Which game to find uploads for

fields.name: uploads
fields.doc: A list of uploads that were found to be compatible.

requests.doc:
Queues an install operation to be later performed
via @@InstallPerformParams.

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc:
ID of the cave to perform the install for.
If not specified, will create a new cave.

fields.name: reason
fields.doc: If unspecified, will default to 'install'

fields.name: installLocationId
fields.doc:
If CaveID is not specified, ID of an install location
to install to.

fields.name: noCave
fields.doc:
If set, InstallFolder can be set and no cave
record will be read or modified

fields.name: installFolder
fields.doc: When NoCave is set, exactly where to install

fields.name: game
fields.doc:
Which game to install.

If unspecified and caveId is specified, the same game will be used.

fields.name: upload
fields.doc:
Which upload to install.

If unspecified and caveId is specified, the same upload will be used.

fields.name: build
fields.doc:
Which build to install

If unspecified and caveId is specified, the same build will be used.

fields.name: ignoreInstallers
fields.doc:
If true, do not run windows installers, just extract
whatever to the install folder.

fields.name: stagingFolder
fields.doc:
A folder that butler can use to store temporary files, like
partial downloads, checkpoint files, etc.

fields.name: queueDownload
fields.doc:
If set, and the install operation is successfully disambiguated,
will queue it as a download for butler to drive.
See @@DownloadsDriveParams.

fields.name: fastQueue
fields.doc: Don't run install prepare (assume we can just run it at perform time)

requests.deprecated: Install.Plan can take a long time calculating space requirements and can't be canceled. Use Install.GetUploads to quickly list available uploads, then Install.PlanUpload to calculate extraction details for a specific upload (with cancellation support).

requests.doc:
Returns the list of available uploads for a game, narrowed by platform/format.
This is the fast part of install planning (no file I/O).

Returns installer type and disk usage info for a specific upload.
This is the slow part of install planning (network I/O + file inspection).

fields.name: id
fields.doc: ID for cancellation support. If provided, can be cancelled via Install.Cancel

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc: ID of the cave to pin/unpin

fields.name: pinned
fields.doc: Pinned state the cave should have after this call

requests.doc: Create a shortcut for an existing cave .

Perform an install that was previously queued via
@@InstallQueueParams.

Can be cancelled by passing the same `ID` to @@InstallCancelParams.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: ID that can be later used in @@InstallCancelParams

fields.name: stagingFolder
fields.doc: The folder turned by @@InstallQueueParams

requests.doc: Attempt to gracefully cancel an ongoing operation.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: The UUID of the task to cancel, as passed to @@OperationStartParams

requests.doc:
UninstallParams contains all the parameters needed to perform
an uninstallation for a game via @@OperationStartParams.

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc: The cave to uninstall

fields.name: hard
fields.doc:
If true, don't attempt to run any uninstallers, just
remove the DB record and burn the install folder to the ground.

requests.doc:
Prepare to queue a version switch. The client will
receive an @@InstallVersionSwitchPickParams.

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc: The cave to switch to a different version

requests.doc: Let the user pick which version to switch to.

fields.name: index
fields.doc: A negative index aborts the version switch

requests.doc: Asks the user to pick between multiple available uploads

fields.name: uploads
fields.doc: An array of upload objects to choose from

fields.name: index
fields.doc:
The index (in the original array) of the upload that was picked,
or a negative value to cancel.

fields.name: id
fields.doc:
identifier of the new install location.
if not specified, will be generated.

fields.name: path
fields.doc: path of the new install location

fields.name: id
fields.doc: identifier of the install location to remove

fields.name: id
fields.doc: identifier of the install location to remove

fields.name: legacyMarketPath
fields.doc: path to a legacy marketDB

requests.doc: Sent at the end of @@InstallLocationsScanParams

fields.name: numItems
fields.doc: number of items that will be imported

requests.doc:
Queue a download that will be performed later by
@@DownloadsDriveParams.
Put a download on top of the queue.
List all known downloads.
Removes all finished downloads from the queue.

Drive downloads, which is: perform them one at a time,
until they're all finished.
Stop driving downloads gracefully.
Retries a download that has errored
Attempts to discard a download

Looks for game updates.

If a list of cave identifiers is passed, will only look for
updates for these caves *and will ignore snooze*.

Otherwise, will look for updates for all games, respecting snooze.

Updates found are regularly sent via @@GameUpdateAvailableNotification, and
then all at once in the result.

fields.name: caveIds
fields.doc: If specified, will only look for updates to these caves

fields.name: verbose
fields.doc: If specified, will log information even when we have no warnings/errors

fields.name: updates
fields.doc: Any updates found (might be empty)

fields.name: warnings
fields.doc: Warnings messages logged while looking for updates

requests.doc:
Snoozing a cave means we ignore all new uploads (that would
be potential updates) between the cave's last install operation
and now.

This can be undone by calling @@CheckUpdateParams with this specific
cave identifier.
Attempt to launch an installed game.

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc: The ID of the cave to launch

fields.name: prereqsDir
fields.doc: The directory to use to store installer files for prerequisites

fields.name: forcePrereqs
fields.doc: Force installing all prerequisites, even if they're already marked as installed

fields.name: sandbox
fields.doc: Enable sandbox (regardless of manifest opt-in)

fields.name: sandboxOptions
fields.doc: Sandbox configuration options. Only applied when sandbox is enabled.

requests.doc:
Sent during @@LaunchParams if the game/application comes with a service license
agreement.

fields.name: text
fields.doc:
The full text of the license agreement, in its default
language, which is usually English.

fields.name: accept
fields.doc:
true if the user accepts the terms of the license, false otherwise.
Note that false will cancel the launch.

requests.doc:
Sent during @@LaunchParams, ask the user to pick a manifest action to launch.

See [itch app manifests](https://itch.io/docs/itch/integrating/manifest.html).

fields.name: actions
fields.doc: A list of actions to pick from. Must be shown to the user in the order they're passed.

fields.name: index
fields.doc: Index of action picked by user, or negative if aborting

requests.doc:
Ask the client to perform a shell launch, ie. open an item
with the operating system's default handler (File explorer).

Sent during @@LaunchParams.

fields.name: itemPath
fields.doc: Absolute path of item to open, e.g. `D:\\Games\\Itch\\garden\\README.txt`

requests.doc:
Ask the client to perform an HTML launch, ie. open an HTML5
game, ideally in an embedded browser.

Sent during @@LaunchParams.

fields.name: rootFolder
fields.doc: Absolute path on disk to serve

fields.name: indexPath
fields.doc: Path of index file, relative to root folder

fields.name: args
fields.doc: Command-line arguments, to pass as `global.Itch.args`

fields.name: env
fields.doc: Environment variables, to pass as `global.Itch.env`

requests.doc:
Ask the client to perform an URL launch, ie. open an address
with the system browser or appropriate.

Sent during @@LaunchParams.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: URL to open, e.g. `https://itch.io/community`

requests.doc:
Ask the user to allow sandbox setup. Will be followed by
a UAC prompt (on Windows) or a pkexec dialog (on Linux) if
the user allows.

Sent during @@LaunchParams.

fields.name: allow
fields.doc: Set to true if user allowed the sandbox setup, false otherwise

requests.doc:
Sent during @@LaunchParams, when one or more prerequisites have failed to install.
The user may choose to proceed with the launch anyway.

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Short error

fields.name: errorStack
fields.doc: Longer error (to include in logs)

fields.name: continue
fields.doc: Set to true if the user wants to proceed with the launch in spite of the prerequisites failure

requests.doc:
Look for folders we can clean up in various download folders.
This finds anything that doesn't correspond to any current downloads
we know about.

fields.name: roots
fields.doc: A list of folders to scan for potential subfolders to clean up

fields.name: whitelist
fields.doc:
A list of subfolders to not consider when cleaning
(staging folders for in-progress downloads)

fields.name: entries
fields.doc: Entries we found that could use some cleaning (with path and size information)

requests.doc: Remove the specified entries from disk, freeing up disk space.
Get information on a filesystem.

Test request: asks butler to double a number twice.
First by calling @@TestDoubleParams, then by
returning the result of that call doubled.

Use that to try out your JSON-RPC 2.0 over TCP implementation.

fields.name: number
fields.doc: The number to quadruple

fields.name: number
fields.doc: The input, quadrupled

requests.doc:
Test request: return a number, doubled. Implement that to
use @@TestDoubleTwiceParams in your testing.

fields.name: number
fields.doc: The number to double

fields.name: number
fields.doc: The number, doubled

fields.name: speedHistory
fields.doc: BPS values for the last minute

fields.name: download
fields.doc:
The download that errored. It contains all the error
information: a short message, a full stack trace,
and a butlerd error code.

notifications.doc:
Sent during @@DownloadsDriveParams to inform on network
status changes.

fields.name: status
fields.doc: The current network status

notifications.doc:
Sent any time butler needs to send a log message. The client should
relay them in their own stdout / stderr, and collect them so they
can be part of an issue report if something goes wrong.

fields.name: level
fields.doc: Level of the message (`info`, `warn`, etc.)

fields.name: message
fields.doc:
Contents of the message.

Note: logs may contain non-ASCII characters, or even emojis.

notifications.doc: The first notification sent when @@MetaFlowParams is called.

fields.name: pid
fields.doc: The identifier of the daemon process for which the flow was established

notifications.doc: Sent periodically during @@InstallPerformParams to inform on the current state of an install

fields.name: progress
fields.doc: An overall progress value between 0 and 1

fields.name: eta
fields.doc: Estimated completion time for the operation, in seconds (floating)

fields.name: bps
fields.doc: Network bandwidth used, in bytes per second (floating)

notifications.doc:
Each operation is made up of one or more tasks. This notification
is sent during @@OperationStartParams whenever a specific task starts.

fields.name: reason
fields.doc: Why this task was started

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Is this task a download? An install?

fields.name: game
fields.doc: The game this task is dealing with

fields.name: upload
fields.doc: The upload this task is dealing with

fields.name: build
fields.doc: The build this task is dealing with (if any)

fields.name: totalSize
fields.doc: Total size in bytes

notifications.doc: Sent during @@OperationStartParams whenever a task succeeds for an operation.

fields.name: installResult
fields.doc:
If the task installed something, then this contains
info about the game, upload, build that were installed

notifications.doc:
Sent during @@InstallLocationsScanParams whenever
a game is found.

Sent during @@CheckUpdateParams, every time butler
finds an update for a game. Can be safely ignored if displaying
updates as they are found is not a requirement for the client.

Sent during @@LaunchParams, when the game is configured, prerequisites are installed
sandbox is set up (if enabled), and the game is actually running.
Sent during @@LaunchParams, when the game has actually exited.

Sent during @@LaunchParams, when some prerequisites are about to be installed.

This is a good time to start showing a UI element with the state of prereq
tasks.

Updates are regularly provided via @@PrereqsTaskStateNotification.

fields.name: tasks
fields.doc: A list of prereqs that need to be tended to

notifications.doc:
Current status of a prerequisite task

Sent during @@LaunchParams, after @@PrereqsStartedNotification, repeatedly
until all prereq tasks are done.

fields.name: name
fields.doc: Short name of the prerequisite task (e.g. `xna-4.0`)

fields.name: status
fields.doc: Current status of the prereq

fields.name: progress
fields.doc: Value between 0 and 1 (floating)

fields.name: eta
fields.doc: ETA in seconds (floating)

fields.name: bps
fields.doc: Network bandwidth used in bytes per second (floating)

notifications.doc:
Sent during @@LaunchParams, when all prereqs have finished installing (successfully or not)

After this is received, it's safe to close any UI element showing prereq task state.

fields.name: action
fields.doc:
The manifest action corresponding to this launch target.
For implicit launch targets, a minimal one will be generated.

fields.name: host
fields.doc: Host this launch target was found for

fields.name: strategy
fields.doc: Detailed launch strategy

structTypes.name: Profile
structTypes.doc:
Represents a user for which we have profile information,
ie. that we can connect as, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: itch.io user ID, doubling as profile ID

fields.name: lastConnected
fields.doc: Timestamp the user last connected at (to the client)

fields.name: user
fields.doc: User information

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Game ID

fields.name: title
fields.doc: Game title

fields.name: cover
fields.doc: Game cover

fields.name: owned
fields.doc: True if owned

fields.name: installedAt
fields.doc: Non-nil if installed (has caves)

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Return only download keys for given game

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Identifier of the game to which this download key grants access

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date this key was created at (often coincides with purchase time)

structTypes.name: Cave
structTypes.doc:
A Cave corresponds to an "installed item" for a game.

It maps one-to-one with an upload. There might be 0, 1, or several
caves for a given game. Multiple caves for a single game is a rare-ish
case (single-page bundles, bonus content) but one that should be handled.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Unique identifier of this cave (UUID)

fields.name: game
fields.doc: Game that's installed in this cave

fields.name: upload
fields.doc: Upload that's installed in this cave

fields.name: build
fields.doc: Build that's installed in this cave, if the upload is wharf-powered

fields.name: stats
fields.doc: Stats about cave usage and first install

fields.name: installInfo
fields.doc: Information about where the cave is installed, how much space it takes up etc.

structTypes.name: CaveStats
structTypes.doc: CaveStats contains stats about cave usage and first install

fields.name: installedAt
fields.doc: Time the cave was first installed

structTypes.name: CaveInstallInfo
structTypes.doc:
CaveInstallInfo contains information about where the cave is installed, how
much space it takes up, etc.

fields.name: installedSize
fields.doc:
Size the cave takes up - or at least, size it took up when we finished
installing it. Does not include files generated by the game in the install folder.

fields.name: installLocation
fields.doc:
Name of the install location for this cave. This may change if the cave
is moved.

fields.name: installFolder
fields.doc: Absolute path to the install folder

fields.name: pinned
fields.doc: If true, this cave is ignored while checking for updates

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Unique identifier for this install location

fields.name: path
fields.doc: Absolute path on disk for this install location

fields.name: sizeInfo
fields.doc: Information about the size used and available at this install location

fields.name: installedSize
fields.doc: Number of bytes used by caves installed in this location

fields.name: freeSize
fields.doc:
Free space at this location (depends on the partition/disk on which
it is), or a negative value if we can't find it

fields.name: totalSize
fields.doc:
Total space of this location (depends on the partition/disk on which
it is), or a negative value if we can't find it

structTypes.name: GameCredentials
structTypes.doc:
GameCredentials contains all the credentials required to make API requests
including the download key if any.

fields.name: apiKey
fields.doc: A valid itch.io API key

fields.name: downloadKey
fields.doc: A download key identifier, or 0 if no download key is available

structTypes.name: Download
structTypes.doc:
Represents a download queued, which will be
performed whenever @@DownloadsDriveParams is called.

structTypes.name: SandboxOptions
structTypes.doc: Options for controlling sandbox behavior.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Which sandbox runner to use. Empty string means auto-detect.

fields.name: noNetwork
fields.doc: (Linux Only) If true, disable network access within the sandbox.

fields.name: allowEnv
fields.doc: (Linux Only) List of environment variable names to allow through from the host into the sandbox.

fields.name: runtime
fields.doc: os + arch, e.g. windows-i386, linux-amd64

fields.name: wrapper
fields.doc: wrapper tool (wine, etc.) that butler can launch itself

fields.name: beforeTarget
fields.doc: wrapper {HERE} game.exe --launch-editor

fields.name: betweenTargetAndArgs
fields.doc: wrapper game.exe {HERE} --launch-editor

fields.name: afterArgs
fields.doc: wrapper game.exe --launch-editor {HERE}

fields.name: wrapperBinary
fields.doc: full path to the wrapper, like "wine"

fields.name: env
fields.doc: additional environment variables

fields.name: needRelativeTarget
fields.doc:
When this is true, the wrapper can't function like this:

$ wine /path/to/game.exe

It needs to function like this:

$ cd /path/to
$ wine game.exe

This is at least true for wine, which cannot find required DLLs
otherwise. This might be true for other wrappers, so it's an option here.

structTypes.name: Verdict
structTypes.doc:
A Verdict contains a wealth of information on how to "launch" or "open" a specific
folder.

fields.name: basePath
fields.doc: BasePath is the absolute path of the folder that was configured

fields.name: totalSize
fields.doc: TotalSize is the size in bytes of the folder and all its children, recursively

fields.name: candidates
fields.doc: Candidates is a list of potentially interesting files, with a lot of additional info

structTypes.name: Candidate
structTypes.doc:
A Candidate is a potentially interesting launch target, be it
a native executable, a Java or Love2D bundle, an HTML index, etc.

fields.name: path
fields.doc: Path is relative to the configured folder

fields.name: mode
fields.doc: Mode describes file permissions

fields.name: depth
fields.doc: Depth is the number of path elements leading up to this candidate

fields.name: flavor
fields.doc: Flavor is the type of a candidate - native, html, jar etc.

fields.name: arch
fields.doc: Arch describes the architecture of a candidate (where relevant)

fields.name: size
fields.doc: Size is the size of the candidate's file, in bytes

fields.name: spell
fields.doc: Spell contains raw output from <https://github.com/itchio/wizardry>

fields.name: windowsInfo
fields.doc: WindowsInfo contains information specific to native Windows candidates

fields.name: linuxInfo
fields.doc: LinuxInfo contains information specific to native Linux candidates

fields.name: macosInfo
fields.doc: MacosInfo contains information specific to native macOS candidates

fields.name: loveInfo
fields.doc: LoveInfo contains information specific to Love2D bundles (`.love` files)

fields.name: scriptInfo
fields.doc: ScriptInfo contains information specific to shell scripts (`.sh`, `.bat` etc.)

fields.name: jarInfo
fields.doc: JarInfo contains information specific to Java archives (`.jar` files)

fields.name: metadata
fields.doc: Any other info.

structTypes.name: WindowsInfo
structTypes.doc:
Contains information specific to native windows executables
or installer packages.

fields.name: installerType
fields.doc: Particular type of installer (msi, inno, etc.)

fields.name: uninstaller
fields.doc: True if we suspect this might be an uninstaller rather than an installer

fields.name: gui
fields.doc: Is this executable marked as GUI? This can be false and still pop a GUI, it's just a hint.

fields.name: dotNet
fields.doc: Is this a .NET assembly?

structTypes.name: MacosInfo
structTypes.doc:
Contains information specific to native macOS executables
or app bundles.

structTypes.name: LinuxInfo
structTypes.doc: Contains information specific to native Linux executables

structTypes.name: LoveInfo
structTypes.doc: Contains information specific to Love2D bundles

fields.name: version
fields.doc: The version of love2D required to open this bundle. May be empty

structTypes.name: ScriptInfo
structTypes.doc: Contains information specific to shell scripts

fields.name: interpreter
fields.doc: Something like `/bin/bash`

structTypes.name: JarInfo
structTypes.doc: Contains information specific to Java archives

fields.name: mainClass
fields.doc: The main Java class as specified by the manifest included in the .jar (if any)

structTypes.name: User
structTypes.doc: User represents an itch.io account, with basic profile info

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: username
fields.doc: The user's username (used for login)

fields.name: displayName
fields.doc: The user's display name: human-friendly, may contain spaces, unicode etc.

fields.name: developer
fields.doc: Has the user opted into creating games?

fields.name: pressUser
fields.doc: Is the user part of itch.io's press program?

fields.name: url
fields.doc: The address of the user's page on itch.io

fields.name: coverUrl
fields.doc: User's avatar, may be a GIF

fields.name: stillCoverUrl
fields.doc: Static version of user's avatar, only set if the main cover URL is a GIF

structTypes.name: Game
structTypes.doc:
Game represents a page on itch.io, it could be a game,
a tool, a comic, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: url
fields.doc: Canonical address of the game's page on itch.io

fields.name: title
fields.doc: Human-friendly title (may contain any character)

fields.name: shortText
fields.doc: Human-friendly short description

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Downloadable game, html game, etc.

fields.name: classification
fields.doc: Classification: game, tool, comic, etc.

fields.name: embed
fields.doc: Configuration for embedded (HTML5) games

fields.name: coverUrl
fields.doc: Cover url (might be a GIF)

fields.name: stillCoverUrl
fields.doc: Non-gif cover url, only set if main cover url is a GIF

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date the game was created

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.doc: Date the game was published, empty if not currently published

fields.name: minPrice
fields.doc: Price in cents of a dollar

fields.name: canBeBought
fields.doc: Are payments accepted?

fields.name: hasDemo
fields.doc: Does this game have a demo available?

fields.name: inPressSystem
fields.doc: Is this game part of the itch.io press system?

fields.name: platforms
fields.doc: Platforms this game is available for

fields.name: user
fields.doc: The user account this game is associated to

fields.name: userId
fields.doc: ID of the user account this game is associated to

fields.name: sale
fields.doc: The best current sale for this game

structTypes.name: Platforms
structTypes.doc:
Platforms describes which OS/architectures a game or upload
is compatible with.

structTypes.name: GameEmbedData
structTypes.doc: GameEmbedData contains presentation information for embed games

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Game this embed info is for

fields.name: width
fields.doc: width of the initial viewport, in pixels

fields.name: height
fields.doc: height of the initial viewport, in pixels

fields.name: fullscreen
fields.doc: for itch.io website, whether or not a fullscreen button should be shown

structTypes.name: Sale
structTypes.doc: Sale describes a discount for a game.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Game this sale is for

fields.name: rate
fields.doc:
Discount rate in percent.
Can be negative, see https://itch.io/updates/introducing-reverse-sales

fields.name: startDate
fields.doc: Timestamp the sale started at

fields.name: endDate
fields.doc: Timestamp the sale ends at

structTypes.name: Upload
structTypes.doc:
An Upload is a downloadable file. Some are wharf-enabled, which means
they're actually a "channel" that may contain multiple builds, pushed
with <https://github.com/itchio/butler>

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: storage
fields.doc: Storage (hosted, external, etc.)

fields.name: host
fields.doc: Host (if external storage)

fields.name: filename
fields.doc: Original file name (example: `Overland_x64.zip`)

fields.name: displayName
fields.doc: Human-friendly name set by developer (example: `Overland for Windows 64-bit`)

fields.name: size
fields.doc: Size of upload in bytes. For wharf-enabled uploads, it's the archive size.

fields.name: channelName
fields.doc: Name of the wharf channel for this upload, if it's a wharf-enabled upload

fields.name: build
fields.doc: Latest build for this upload, if it's a wharf-enabled upload

fields.name: buildId
fields.doc: ID of the latest build for this upload, if it's a wharf-enabled upload

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Upload type: default, soundtrack, etc.

fields.name: preorder
fields.doc: Is this upload a pre-order placeholder?

fields.name: demo
fields.doc: Is this upload a free demo?

fields.name: platforms
fields.doc: Platforms this upload is compatible with

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date this upload was created at

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.doc: Date this upload was last updated at (order changed, display name set, etc.)

structTypes.name: Collection
structTypes.doc: A Collection is a set of games, curated by humans.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: title
fields.doc: Human-friendly title for collection, for example `Couch coop games`

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date this collection was created at

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.doc: Date this collection was last updated at (item added, title set, etc.)

fields.name: gamesCount
fields.doc:
Number of games in the collection. This might not be accurate
as some games might not be accessible to whoever is asking (project
page deleted, visibility level changed, etc.)

fields.name: collectionGames
fields.doc: Games in this collection, with additional info

structTypes.name: CollectionGame
structTypes.doc: CollectionGame represents a game's membership for a collection.

structTypes.name: DownloadKey
structTypes.doc:
A DownloadKey is often generated when a purchase is made, it
allows downloading uploads for a game that are not available
for free. It can also be generated by other means.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: gameId
fields.doc: Identifier of the game to which this download key grants access

fields.name: game
fields.doc: Game to which this download key grants access

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date this key was created at (often coincides with purchase time)

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.doc: Date this key was last updated at

fields.name: ownerId
fields.doc: Identifier of the itch.io user to which this key belongs

structTypes.name: Build
structTypes.doc: Build contains information about a specific build

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: parentBuildId
fields.doc:
Identifier of the build before this one on the same channel,
or 0 if this is the initial build.

fields.name: state
fields.doc: State of the build: started, processing, etc.

fields.name: version
fields.doc: Automatically-incremented version number, starting with 1

fields.name: userVersion
fields.doc:
Value specified by developer with `--userversion` when pushing a build
Might not be unique across builds of a given channel.

fields.name: files
fields.doc:
Files associated with this build - often at least an archive,
a signature, and a patch. Some might be missing while the build
is still processing or if processing has failed.

fields.name: user
fields.doc: User who pushed the build

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Timestamp the build was created at

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.doc: Timestamp the build was last updated at

structTypes.name: BuildFile
structTypes.doc:
BuildFile contains information about a build's "file", which could be its
archive, its signature, its patch, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Site-wide unique identifier generated by itch.io

fields.name: size
fields.doc: Size of this build file

fields.name: state
fields.doc: State of this file: created, uploading, uploaded, etc.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: Type of this build file: archive, signature, patch, etc.

fields.name: subType
fields.doc: Subtype of this build file, usually indicates compression

fields.name: createdAt
fields.doc: Date this build file was created at

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.doc: Date this build file was last updated at

fields.name: error
fields.doc: Short error

fields.name: errorStack
fields.doc: Longer error

fields.name: attempted
fields.doc: Name of the operation we were trying to do

fields.name: problem
fields.doc: Problem encountered while trying "attempted"

fields.name: nowTrying
fields.doc: Name of the operation we're falling back to

fields.name: buildID
fields.doc: Build we patched to

fields.name: subtype
fields.doc: "default" or "optimized" (for the +bsdiff variant)

fields.name: operation
fields.doc: Operation that requested the ghost busting (install, upgrade, heal)

fields.name: found
fields.doc: Number of ghost files found

fields.name: removed
fields.doc: Number of ghost files removed

structTypes.name: Receipt
structTypes.doc:
A Receipt describes what was installed to a specific folder.

It's compressed and written to `./.itch/receipt.json.gz` every
time an install operation completes successfully, and is used
in further install operations to make sure ghosts are busted and/or
angels are saved.

fields.name: game
fields.doc: The itch.io game installed at this location

fields.name: upload
fields.doc: The itch.io upload installed at this location

fields.name: build
fields.doc: The itch.io build installed at this location. Null for non-wharf upload.

fields.name: files
fields.doc: A list of installed files (slash-separated paths, relative to install folder)

fields.name: installerName
fields.doc: The installer used to install at this location

structTypes.name: Manifest
structTypes.doc:
A Manifest describes prerequisites (dependencies) and actions that
can be taken while launching a game.

fields.name: actions
fields.doc: Actions are a list of options to give the user when launching a game.

fields.name: prereqs
fields.doc:
Prereqs describe libraries or frameworks that must be installed
prior to launching a game

structTypes.name: Action
structTypes.doc:
An Action is a choice for the user to pick when launching a game.

see https://itch.io/docs/itch/integrating/manifest.html

fields.name: name
fields.doc: human-readable or standard name

fields.name: path
fields.doc: file path (relative to manifest or absolute), URL, etc.

fields.name: icon
fields.doc: icon name (see static/fonts/icomoon/demo.html, don't include `icon-` prefix)

fields.name: args
fields.doc: command-line arguments

fields.name: sandbox
fields.doc: sandbox opt-in

fields.name: scope
fields.doc: requested API scope

fields.name: console
fields.doc: don't redirect stdout/stderr, open in new console window

fields.name: platform
fields.doc: platform to restrict this action to

fields.name: locales
fields.doc: localized action name

fields.name: name
fields.doc: A prerequisite to be installed, see <https://itch.io/docs/itch/integrating/prereqs/> for the full list.

fields.name: name
fields.doc: A localized action name

structTypes.name: Runtime
structTypes.doc: Runtime describes an os-arch combo in a convenient way

structTypes.name: InstallResult
structTypes.doc:
What was installed by a subtask of @@OperationStartParams.

See @@TaskSucceededNotification.

fields.name: game
fields.doc: The game we installed

fields.name: upload
fields.doc: The upload we installed

fields.name: build
fields.doc: The build we installed

structTypes.name: GameUpdate
structTypes.doc: Describes an available update for a particular game install.

fields.name: caveId
fields.doc: Cave we found an update for

fields.name: game
fields.doc: Game we found an update for

fields.name: direct
fields.doc:
True if this is a direct update, ie. we're on
a channel that still exists, and there's a new build
False if it's an indirect update, for example a new
upload that appeared after we installed, but we're
not sure if it's an upgrade or other additional content

fields.name: choices
fields.doc: Available choice of updates

structTypes.name: GameUpdateChoice
structTypes.doc: One possible upload/build choice to upgrade a cave

fields.name: upload
fields.doc: Upload to be installed

fields.name: build
fields.doc: Build to be installed (may be nil)

fields.name: confidence
fields.doc: How confident we are that this is the right upgrade

structTypes.name: PrereqTask
structTypes.doc: Information about a prerequisite task.

fields.name: fullName
fields.doc: Full name of the prerequisite, for example: `Microsoft .NET Framework 4.6.2`

fields.name: order
fields.doc: Order of task in the list. Respect this order in the UI if you want consistent progress indicators.

fields.name: path
fields.doc: The complete path of the file or folder we intend to remove

fields.name: size
fields.doc: The size of the folder or file, in bytes

values.name: Owned
values.doc: Games for which the profile has a download key

values.name: Installed
values.doc: Games for which a cave exists (regardless of the profile)

values.name: Profile
values.doc: Games authored by profile, or for whom profile is an admin of

values.name: Collection
values.doc: Games from a collection

values.name: Debug
values.doc: Hidden from logs by default, noisy

values.name: Info
values.doc: Just thinking out loud

values.name: Warning
values.doc: We're continuing, but we're not thrilled about it

values.name: Error
values.doc: We're eventually going to fail loudly

values.name: OperationCancelled
values.doc: An operation was cancelled gracefully

values.name: OperationAborted
values.doc: An operation was aborted by the user

values.name: InstallFolderDisappeared
values.doc: We tried to launch something, but the install folder just wasn't there

values.name: NoCompatibleUploads
values.doc: We tried to install something, but could not find compatible uploads

values.name: UnsupportedHost
values.doc: This title is hosted on an incompatible third-party website

values.name: NoLaunchCandidates
values.doc: Nothing that can be launched was found

values.name: JavaRuntimeNeeded
values.doc: Java Runtime Environment is required to launch this title.

values.name: NetworkDisconnected
values.doc: There is no Internet connection

values.name: APIError
values.doc: API error

values.name: DatabaseBusy
values.doc: The database is busy

values.name: CantRemoveLocationBecauseOfActiveDownloads
values.doc: An install location could not be removed because it has active downloads

enumTypes.name: Flavor
enumTypes.doc: Flavor describes whether we're dealing with a native executables, a Java archive, a love2d bundle, etc.

values.name: NativeLinux
values.doc: FlavorNativeLinux denotes native linux executables

values.name: NativeMacos
values.doc: ExecNativeMacos denotes native macOS executables

values.name: NativeWindows
values.doc: FlavorPe denotes native windows executables

values.name: AppMacos
values.doc: FlavorAppMacos denotes a macOS app bundle

values.name: Script
values.doc: FlavorScript denotes scripts starting with a shebang (#!)

values.name: ScriptWindows
values.doc: FlavorScriptWindows denotes windows scripts (.bat or .cmd)

values.name: Jar
values.doc: FlavorJar denotes a .jar archive with a Main-Class

values.name: HTML
values.doc: FlavorHTML denotes an index html file

values.name: Love
values.doc: FlavorLove denotes a love package

values.name: MSI
values.doc: Microsoft installer packages
32-bit

values.name: Amd64
values.doc: 64-bit

enumTypes.name: WindowsInstallerType
enumTypes.doc: Which particular type of windows-specific installer

values.name: Msi
values.doc: Microsoft install packages (`.msi` files)

values.name: Inno
values.doc: InnoSetup installers

values.name: Nullsoft
values.doc: NSIS installers

values.name: Archive
values.doc: Self-extracting installers that 7-zip knows how to extract

enumTypes.name: Architectures
enumTypes.doc: Architectures describes a set of processor architectures (mostly 32-bit vs 64-bit)

values.name: All
values.doc: ArchitecturesAll represents any processor architecture
Architectures386 represents 32-bit processor architectures

values.name: Amd64
values.doc: ArchitecturesAmd64 represents 64-bit processor architectures

enumTypes.name: GameType
enumTypes.doc:
GameType is the type of an itch.io game page, mostly related to
how it should be presented on web (downloadable or embed)

values.name: Default
values.doc: GameTypeDefault is downloadable games

values.name: Flash
values.doc: GameTypeFlash is for .swf (legacy)

values.name: Unity
values.doc: GameTypeUnity is for .unity3d (legacy)

values.name: Java
values.doc: GameTypeJava is for .jar (legacy)

values.name: HTML
values.doc: GameTypeHTML is for .html (thriving)

enumTypes.name: GameClassification
enumTypes.doc: GameClassification is the creator-picked classification for a page

values.name: Game
values.doc: GameClassificationGame is something you can play

values.name: Tool
values.doc: GameClassificationTool includes all software pretty much

values.name: Assets
values.doc: GameClassificationAssets includes assets: graphics, sounds, etc.

values.name: GameMod
values.doc: GameClassificationGameMod are game mods (no link to game, purely creator tagging)

values.name: PhysicalGame
values.doc: GameClassificationPhysicalGame is for a printable / board / card game

values.name: Soundtrack
values.doc: GameClassificationSoundtrack is a bunch of music files

values.name: Other
values.doc: GameClassificationOther is anything that creators think don't fit in any other category

values.name: Comic
values.doc: GameClassificationComic is a comic book (pdf, jpg, specific comic formats, etc.)

values.name: Book
values.doc: GameClassificationBook is a book (pdf, jpg, specific e-book formats, etc.)

enumTypes.name: UploadStorage
enumTypes.doc: UploadStorage describes where an upload file is stored.

values.name: Hosted
values.doc: UploadStorageHosted is a classic upload (web) - no versioning

values.name: Build
values.doc: UploadStorageBuild is a wharf upload (butler)

values.name: External
values.doc: UploadStorageExternal is an external upload - alllllllll bets are off.

enumTypes.name: UploadType
enumTypes.doc:
UploadType describes what's in an upload - an executable,
a web game, some music, etc.

values.name: Default
values.doc: UploadTypeDefault is for executables

values.name: Flash
values.doc: UploadTypeFlash is for .swf files

values.name: Unity
values.doc: UploadTypeUnity is for .unity3d files

values.name: Java
values.doc: UploadTypeJava is for .jar files

values.name: HTML
values.doc: UploadTypeHTML is for .html files

values.name: Soundtrack
values.doc: UploadTypeSoundtrack is for archives with .mp3/.ogg/.flac/etc files

values.name: Book
values.doc: UploadTypeBook is for books (epubs, pdfs, etc.)

values.name: Video
values.doc: UploadTypeVideo is for videos

values.name: Documentation
values.doc: UploadTypeDocumentation is for documentation (pdf, maybe uhh doxygen?)

values.name: Mod
values.doc: UploadTypeMod is a bunch of loose files with no clear instructions how to apply them to a game

values.name: AudioAssets
values.doc: UploadTypeAudioAssets is a bunch of .ogg/.wav files

values.name: GraphicalAssets
values.doc: UploadTypeGraphicalAssets is a bunch of .png/.svg/.gif files, maybe some .objs thrown in there

values.name: Sourcecode
values.doc: UploadTypeSourcecode is for source code. No further comments.

values.name: Other
values.doc:
UploadTypeOther is for literally anything that isn't an existing category,
or for stuff that isn't tagged properly.

enumTypes.name: BuildState
enumTypes.doc:
BuildState describes the state of a build, relative to its initial upload, and
its processing.

values.name: Started
values.doc: BuildStateStarted is the state of a build from its creation until the initial upload is complete

values.name: Processing
values.doc:
BuildStateProcessing is the state of a build from the initial upload's completion to its fully-processed state.
This state does not mean the build is actually being processed right now, it's just queued for processing.

values.name: Completed
values.doc:
BuildStateCompleted means the build was successfully processed. Its patch hasn't necessarily been
rediff'd yet, but we have the holy (patch,signature,archive) trinity.

values.name: Failed
values.doc:
BuildStateFailed means something went wrong with the build. A failing build will not update the channel
head and can be requeued by the itch.io team, although if a new build is pushed before they do,
that new build will "win".

enumTypes.name: BuildFileState
enumTypes.doc: BuildFileState describes the state of a specific file for a build

values.name: Created
values.doc: BuildFileStateCreated means the file entry exists on itch.io

values.name: Uploading
values.doc: BuildFileStateUploading means the file is currently being uploaded to storage

values.name: Uploaded
values.doc: BuildFileStateUploaded means the file is ready

values.name: Failed
values.doc: BuildFileStateFailed means the file failed uploading

enumTypes.name: BuildFileType
enumTypes.doc: BuildFileType describes the type of a build file: patch, archive, signature, etc.

values.name: Patch
values.doc: BuildFileTypePatch describes wharf patch files (.pwr)

values.name: Archive
values.doc: BuildFileTypeArchive describes canonical archive form (.zip)

values.name: Signature
values.doc: BuildFileTypeSignature describes wharf signature files (.pws)

values.name: Manifest
values.doc: BuildFileTypeManifest is reserved

values.name: Unpacked
values.doc: BuildFileTypeUnpacked describes the single file that is in the build (if it was just a single file)

enumTypes.name: BuildFileSubType
enumTypes.doc:
BuildFileSubType describes the subtype of a build file: mostly its compression
level. For example, rediff'd patches are "optimized", whereas initial patches are "default"

values.name: Default
values.doc: BuildFileSubTypeDefault describes default compression (rsync patches)

values.name: Gzip
values.doc: BuildFileSubTypeGzip is reserved

values.name: Optimized
values.doc: BuildFileSubTypeOptimized describes optimized compression (rediff'd / bsdiff patches)

values.name: InstallEventResume
values.doc:
Started for the first time or resumed after a pause
or exit or whatever

values.name: InstallEventStop
values.doc:
Stopped explicitly (pausing downloads), can't rely
on this being present because BRTAL PWER LSS will
not announce itself

values.name: InstallEventInstall
values.doc: Regular install from archive or naked file

values.name: InstallEventHeal
values.doc:
Reverting to previous version or re-installing
wharf-powered upload

values.name: InstallEventUpgrade
values.doc: Applying one or more wharf patches

values.name: InstallEventPatching
values.doc: Applying a single wharf patch

values.name: InstallEventGhostBusting
values.doc: Cleaning up ghost files

values.name: InstallEventProblem
values.doc: Any kind of step failing

values.name: InstallEventFallback
values.doc:
Any operation we do as a result of another one failing,
but in a case where we're still expecting a favorable
outcome eventually.

values.name: Install
values.doc: Task was started for an install operation

values.name: Uninstall
values.doc: Task was started for an uninstall operation

values.name: Download
values.doc: We're fetching files from a remote server

values.name: Install
values.doc: We're running an installer

values.name: Uninstall
values.doc: We're running an uninstaller

values.name: Update
values.doc: We're applying some patches

values.name: Heal
values.doc: We're healing from a signature and heal source

values.name: Pending
values.doc: Prerequisite has not started downloading yet

values.name: Downloading
values.doc: Prerequisite is currently being downloaded

values.name: Ready
values.doc: Prerequisite has been downloaded and is pending installation

values.name: Installing
values.doc: Prerequisite is currently installing

values.name: Done
values.doc: Prerequisite was installed (successfully or not)
